results.title: Electrical safety in the workplace
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safetycare”.
Looks at the effects and potential hazards associated with electricity, including definitions of basic terms, facts about how electricity is conducted and the effects of electrical currents on the human body. It identifies common hazards found in the workplace including overhead power lines, damp locations and the use of extension cords, as well as the importance of insulation and wearing appropriate personal protective equipment. Presented by Peter Mitchell.

results.title: Building Evacuation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safetycare”.
Runners, floor wardens, chief warden, warning systems, communication systems, Master Emergency Communication Point, assembly areas, mobility impaired people, order of evacuation, when to evacuate…these are just some of the details that need to be considered in the evacuation of a building. Every person in a building needs to know their role in an evacuation. This video addresses the principles of evacuation of any building.

results.title: Bomb threat strategy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safetycare”
Preventative measures, what to look for, search procedures, assessing the threat, the telephone call, when to evacuate and the correct evacuation procedures are the key points covered in this video.

results.title: The Lost 600
results.creator_credit: Michael Robertson, New South Wales. Dept. of Sport and Recreation and Michael Robertson Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safety in, on and near the water”.
Emphasises the dangers associated with foolish, unsafe and reckless behaviour in and on the water. Among the many aspects of water safety covered are still-water drownings, surf safety, boating, yachting, water skiing, rock fishing and home pools.

results.title: Dermatitis
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safety”.
Dermatitis is a problem in many industries. This film shows how dermatitis is caused and how it can be avoided. Dermatitis in the home is also briefly discussed.

results.title: Seeing
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safety”.
Industrial accidents can permanently damage eyesight. The film stresses the necessity of providing protective faceguards and taking precautions at all times.

results.title: Hearing
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safety”.
Very few people suddenly go deaf, but prolonged exposure to high noise levels can cause serious damage. The film shows how deafness is caused and how objectional noise can be controlled.
